Word.Root: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, something that happens often; many, numerous.

Meaning.Definition: كَثُرَ aor. يَكْثُرُ and يَكْثِرُ inf. noun كَثْرَةٌ : It was or became much,copious, many, numerous; it multiplied. كَثَرُوْا عَلَيْهِ فَغَلَبُوْهُ : They multiplied against him and overcame him.
Meaning.Example: Token(4:8:13:17) Whether it be little or much (4:8).
Token(7:87:1:3) فَكَثَّرَكُمْ : So He multiplied you (7:87).
Token(89:13:1:2) And they wrought much corruption therein (89:13).

Meaning.Definition: تَكَاثَرُوْا : They contended one with another for superiority in number. اَلتَّكَاثُرُ : Signifies the contending together for superiority in amount or number of property and children and men (102:2).
اِسْتَكْثَرَ مِنَ الشَّىْءِ : He desired or wished or sought for much of a thing; he reckoned it much or many.
Meaning.Example: Token(7:189:1:3) He should have secured abundance of good (7:189).

Meaning.Definition: اَكْثَرَ : Comparative degree of كَثِيْرٌ as كَوْثَرٌ : A lord or master; abounding in good; a man possessing much good and who gives much (108:2).
